text.headline: A timeline of Bing-AI:<h2> What Microsoft knew and when they knew it<h2>
text.text: OpenAI's ChatGPT took the world by storm and was quickly implemented into Bing search. As the uncanny abilities of Large Language AI Models (LLM's) continue to usher excitement, concerns remain about their effects in the real-world

media.caption: Tay's (bot) Twitter Profile Image
media.credit:
Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Microsoft releases chatbot Tay
text.text: Under the malign influence from some users, it quickly begins to spout racist rhetoric. Tay is retracted 16 hours later, for being a “racist asshole”

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Microsoft releases their Responsible AI Standard
text.text: Microsoft releases their Responsible AI Standard, “an important step in [the] journey to develop better, more trustworthy AI”.

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
GM Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: OpenAI release ChatGPT to incredible acclaim

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
GM Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Microsoft President Brad Smith positions Microsoft as the responsible AI company
text.text: Microsoft President Brad Smith, an attorney who was once their General Counsel, positions Microsoft as the responsible AI company, with the first boldfaced principle being “First, we must ensure that AI is built and used responsibly and ethically”, and noting “First, these issues are too important to be left to technologists alone.”

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
GM Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Bing Chat is quietly released in India

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
GM Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Bing Chat is released globally
text.text: In tandem with OpenAI, to enormous acclaim

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
GM Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Bing Chat goes wild
text.text: Internet goes wild with reports of Bing chat (code named Sydney) going off the rails

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.

text.headline: Bing's Chatbot gets Jailbroken
text.text: Utilizing prompts to undermine its guardrails, ex-Microsoft, current Chief Expeirence officer at Textie, Jensen Harris uses the ChatGPT-powered chatbot to lie, cheat, and relay potentially nefarious information

media.caption: Houston's with her mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston and cousin Dionne Warwick.

text.headline: A Work in Progress
text.text:
Microsoft, Google, Meta, and Amazon are racing to get ahead with their own LLM, and in doing so are ignoring both real and expected issues.
What is the price of overselling the capacity of these technologies?
